associates.name: Peter and Cheryl Loewen
associates.career: Associate Professor of Musicology, Shepherd School of Music; Cheryl Assistant Director of the Moore Memorial Public Library in Texas City
associates.bio: Peter Loewen is Associate Professor of musicology at Rice University where he specializes in Medieval and Renaissance music. His research interests concern vernacular song, religious drama, intellectual history, music and preaching, and the Franciscans. Peter Loewen was born in Uganda to naturalized Canadian citizens who, in their youth, had emigrated from Ukraine after WWII. Cheryl Loewen was born in Dauphin, Manitoba, Canada. She has a Bachelors degree in Commerce from the University of Manitoba and a Master degree in Library Science from UNT. Peter and Cheryl have 4 children ages 15-23.
associates.movie_tv: At the moment, Game of Thrones.
associates.hobbies: Beer Brewing
associates.fact: Peter may be a citizen of Uganda.

associates.name: Iska Wire
associates.career: Rice University, Talent Management and Development
associates.bio: I grew up in Houston and attended Trinity University.  I've been in fundraising for 17 years and currently do talent management for Development and Alumni Relations.  I am divorced and have two children - Elsie (12) and Wyatt (11) who are both in Scottish arts (highland dancing and bag piping) at their school plus a Siamese cat named Wooley.
associates.hobbies: Scrapbooking, Photography, Girl Scouts, Rodeo and country and western dancing
associates.fact: I was a Gold Award Girl Scout and as a kid, sold over 2000 boxes of cookies each year.

associates.name: Michelle Passo
associates.career: Center for Career Development (Rice University)
associates.bio: This is my 10th year in the CCD! Through the years, I've worked in different roles from managing the Owl Edge Externship Program to helping employers recruit Rice talent, to working with students as they create their resumes and practice their interviewing skills. My husband and I are huge college hoops fans. Our daughter loves having dinner with the 'Rice kids' at Associates Night(s)! We have a rambunctious dog named Cubbie (after the Chicago Cubs, of course).
associates.hobbies: Basketball spectating (college and NBA), running, yoga
associates.fact: I used to work in the Commissioner's Office at the National Basketball Association (NBA) in New York City

associates.name: Theo Mallinson
associates.career: Oil and gas industry as an engineer
associates.bio: Graduated from Rice in 1995, have worked in oil and gas since then. Several stints overseas, but back in Houston now for two kids to go through school. Live near campus with family and currently three chickens.
associates.hobbies: Soccer, swimming, gardening, video games.
associates.fact: I enjoy low environmental impact home 'systems' and am currently trying to perfect a kind of urban mini farm at our house.

associates.name: Emily Houlik-Ritchey
associates.career: English Department, Rice U.
associates.bio: I teach and research the literature of the Middle Ages written in medieval English and Spanish, studying the interaction of these cultural traditions with the wider medieval Mediterranean world. I am originally from Colorado, and my family (including a husband and two spunky kids) travel back there regularly to hike, ski, and see family.
associates.movie_tv: Foyle's War; Jane Austen film adaptations; Rogue One
associates.hobbies: Raising my kids; Reading for fun; Hiking
associates.fact: Periodically (as they migrate through Houston) I foster monarch butterfly caterpillars through their metamorphosis into butterflies.

associates.name: Alese Pickering
associates.career: Rice Magazine (part of Public Affairs at Rice)
associates.bio: I am a graphic-designing, food-loving, cat-mothering, native Houstonian.
associates.hobbies: Cooking, photography, reading magazines, collecting art
associates.fact: I love driving long distance. Road trips are the best.

associates.name: Dereth Phillips
associates.career: Rice University, Lecturer
associates.bio: I have worked as a lecturer in the Rice BioSciences (Biochemistry & Cell Biology) department since 2000 and have been a member of the McMurtry family since 2010. My day job is advising Natural Sciences students interested in finding and succeeding in undergraduate research opportunities on campus and elsewhere in Houston. I am a terrible but devoted ukulele/banjolele hobbyist.
associates.hobbies: Cooking, ukulele, playing other odd instruments, singing
associates.fact: Rice has a lot of cool nature. Take a look at the lizards around McMurtry. The brown ones with diamonds are invasive Cuban anoles. The green (sometimes plain brown) ones are native.

associates.name: Laura S. Kabiri
associates.career: Lecturer - Department of Kinesiology
associates.bio: Hello from the Department of Kinesiology at Rice! I primarily teach human anatomy and physiology courses while my research focuses on pediatric health and wellness. I am also a licensed physical therapist, wife, and mom of 3 (but one of them has four paws and a tail).
associates.hobbies: Eating
associates.fact: I completed undergrad as a music major (piano and choir) before going on PT school and have volunteered with the Houston Food Bank, Houston Rodeo, and Faithful Paws Animal Therapy Group.

associates.name: Zoë Wool
associates.career: Assistant Professor, Department of Anthropology, CSWGS, and Medical Humanities
associates.bio: I’m a native New Yorker and erstwhile Torontonian still getting used to Houston’s car culture and the fact that people put blankets on their lawns when there is a frost warning. My resarch and teaching are at the intersections of medical anthropology, disability studies, queer theory, and STS, and most of my ethnographic resarch is with injured US soldiers and veterans of the post-9/11 wars.
associates.movie_tv: I don’t like to pick favorites (but maybe Startrek TNG)
associates.hobbies: Making meals, making mischief.
associates.fact: I usually ride my bike to work and have been known to yell at my students who ride theirs without a helemet.

associates.name: Kurt and Stephanie Kasper
associates.career: The University of Texas School of Dentistry at Houston
associates.bio: Kurt Kasper earned a doctorate in bioengineering from Rice University and a bachelor of science degree in biomedical engineering (magna cum laude) from Case Western Reserve University. He served on the faculty of the Department of Bioengineering at Rice University for six years prior to transitioning to the Department of Orthodontics at The University of Texas School of Dentistry at Houston in July 2014. Kurt’s research applies fundamentals of engineering, materials science, and the biosciences toward the development and evaluation of biomaterial-based technologies to meet clinical needs. Outside of the  laboratory, he enjoys engagement in outreach activities through service with the You Be the Chemist Challenge program of the Chemical Educational Foundation, as well as service to the greater Houston community in various capacities, including past service as a member of the Board of Directors of the Association of Rice Alumni.
associates.hobbies: Parks, museums, and cycling with my family
associates.fact: I applied to Rice for undergraduate studies but was not accepted!

associates.name: E. Kate Abad
associates.career: Student Center Director, Rice
associates.bio: E. Kate Abad has worked at Rice University for ten years, where she currently serves as the Student Center Director with oversight for the Student Run Businesses, Facilities and Events, and Student Activities. Kate has a passion for developing student and professional leaders through coaching, leadership development and advising.  As a hobby she loves anything related to journaling and is always willing to help aspiring journal writers get started!
associates.hobbies: Journaling - bullet, art, classic
associates.fact: I grew up in Japan and on Guam

associates.name: Ozge Gurcanli, Simon Fischer-Baum, Masal Baby-Murt
associates.career: OG & SFB: Department of Psychology, Masal: Unicorn Land
associates.bio: We both work in Department of Psychology and we teach Psychology and Cognitive Science courses. We lived in McM as RAs for 4 years, students named our child Baby-Murt, and we are so proud of all McM students.
associates.movie_tv: OG: Marvellous Miss Maisel, SFB: Russian Doll, Masal: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood
associates.hobbies: OG: Photography, SFB: Cooking, Masal: Acting, scooting, and drawing
associates.fact: OG loves tea! A lot. Also sewing. We all love art work with tactile materials.

associates.name: Norma Torres Mendoza & Placido Andres Gomez
associates.career: Norma (MBA Candidate at Rice Business School) Placido (Senior Associate at Safal Partners)
associates.bio: Norma and Placido have been married for three years and live in Houston, TX. Both of them are Rice undergrads (they met at Urban Immersion) in 2013. They both then attended Harvard for their Masters. Placido has a background in politics and education and Norma has focused on the intersection of business and the public sector.
associates.hobbies: Tennis, cooking, traveling, and reading at different coffeeshops
associates.fact: Plaz is a great tennis player (state champion from New Mexico) and Norma appeared in the Barney and Friends show (you know, the purple dinosaur)

associates.name: Keri Bas
associates.career: I teach sewing & textile arts, often with a non-profit working in schools & shelters.
associates.bio: After years in professional marketing and web design, I now split my time between sewing/quilting and working with private tech/web support clients. I share my house with my parents and two cats. I serve on the board of a local arts non-profit and lead several groups of creatives. I'm an interfaith minister, ordained in New York in 2005 - ask me about it sometime.
associates.movie_tv: Good Omens, The Princess Bride, Ladyhawke, Iron Man, The Lion in Winter, Harvey, Moana / Babylon 5, Star Trek, Midsomer Murders, Bob's Burgers, Brooklyn 99, Vera
associates.hobbies: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons; making & drinking fine teas; arguing about Marvel & Harry Potter & scifi movies over coffee late into the night; reading; writing; painting; drawing; traveling when the budget allows
associates.fact: I was on a TV game show in the early 00s when I lived in New York; people still text me when they catch the re-runs.

associates.name: Nicole Van Den Heuvel
associates.career: Executive Director -Center for Career Development
associates.bio: '81 Rice alumna - Love being back at Rice and helping our students find their career paths and gain confidence in their career development process.
associates.hobbies: Horseback riding, travel, museums
associates.fact: From Aruba. Lived in 8 different countries. Went to 13 schools in 12 years.

associates.name: Lauren Stadler
associates.career: Assistant Professor, CEVE
associates.bio: I am an environmental engineer and my research and teaching focus on biological water treatment processes and the microbes in our water systems. I am a mom to one toddler and two sweet but poorly behaved doggies.
associates.hobbies: Biking, soccer, eating ice cream
associates.fact: I kill most plants that I try and grow.

associates.name: Mark Krouskop
associates.career: Rice University, Hamman Hall, Lecturer Theater Design
associates.bio: My name is Mark Krouskop. I am a theater design lecturer in VADA. Come by Hamman Hall and I’d be happy to give you more details.
associates.hobbies: Playing volleyball, video games, collecting 1980-present toys, making fine furniture.
associates.fact: I have 3 ferrets and a Great Dane.

associates.name: Danielle King
associates.career: Rice University, Assistant Professor in Psychological Sciences
associates.bio: I started at Rice in 2018, after completing my undergrad training in Psychology at Spelman College and my MA and PhD in Organizational Psychology at Michigan State. I am originally from New Orleans, LA. I started the WorKing Resilience Research Lab at Rice because I am passionate about understanding how we can foster resilience and wellbeing in employees and organizations.
associates.movie_tv: Black Panther. The Notebook. Big Bang Theory. Good Trouble.
associates.hobbies: Traveling. Trying new workouts. Painting.
associates.fact: I love adventure: I went skydiving in New Zealand and swimming with sharks in Belize.

associates.name: Cassandra Diep & Jeffrey Yeung
associates.career: Assistant Teaching Professor, Kinesiology Department (CD); Senior Accounting & Business Analyst, Controller’s Office (JY)
associates.bio: Cassie and Jeff grew up in Houston and attended the same middle and high schools, but they didn’t start dating until they were both in graduate school at Texas A&M. Cassie is an Owl-Aggie (Rice for undergrad and A&M for grad school), and Jeff is a full-blown Aggie. They have been married since 2013 and have two young children: Alex, who loves superheroes and all things that go, and Alyssa, who loves all things that her brother loves. Cassie currently teaches and advises in the Health Sciences program within Kinesiology, while Jeff is involved with various aspects of Rice’s accounting.
associates.hobbies: Arts and crafts, baking (CD); Cars, cooking, shoes (JY)
associates.fact: Cassie and Jeff “swam” with dolphins while honeymooning in Hawaii (well, Jeff swam, while Cassie stood in the water nearby).

associates.name: Geoff Wehmeyer
associates.career: Assistant Professor Rice Department of Mechanical Engineering
associates.bio: I'm a mechanical engineer, and my research focuses on understanding heat transport at the nanoscale. I was born in Dallas, went to undergrad at UT Austin, and came to Rice in 2018 after finishing my Ph.D. at Berkeley. My wife Lauren is also a mechanical engineer from Texas, and we love spending time with our niece and nephews in San Antonio and exploring Houston.
associates.hobbies: Hiking, camping, reading fiction, going to shows
associates.fact: At one point, I could throw a javelin >130 feet

associates.name: Jennifer Zinn-Winkler
associates.career: Department Administrator - Department of Kinesiology at Rice University
associates.bio: I have been at Rice since moving to the Houston area in 2012.  Originally from Austin, I received my BS degree in Kinesiology from UT Austin.  My husband Lance & I have an almost 2 year old daughter who keeps us on our toes.
associates.hobbies: Traveling, movies w/ friends, building blocks w/ the toddler
associates.fact: I've met Matthew McConaughey twice & have two pictures with him.  He's so awesome!

associates.name: Margaret Beier
associates.career: Professor
associates.bio: I am a psychology professor at Rice from Minneapolis who is a proud retired McMurtry Magister! I love McMurtry!!!! We lived on campus from 2015 to 2020 (my daughters, Lucy, Liza, my husband, Chris, and our dogs, Oscar and Felix)
associates.hobbies: Reading and cooking
associates.fact: I love Prince.

associates.name: Catherine Evans
associates.career: Attorney
associates.bio: I grew up in New Orleans but moved to Houston in 1997 to attend law school and never left. I'm Board Certified in Criminal Law and have been working in the local criminal justice community for 20 years. My husband Jim graduated from Rice, so we've always lived nearby and enjoy going back on campus whenever possible. We have a ping-pong table and our kids would welcome the challenge from any students looking to get off-campus for a few hours!
associates.hobbies: Gardening
associates.fact: We currently have a 16 year old exchange student from Turkey living with us for the year.

associates.name: Chan Pham
associates.career: Research Administrator
associates.bio: I've been with Rice (BIOE department) since 2008 and my daughters graduated from Rice.  My one advises for students to take advantage of all the resources Rice offers.
associates.movie_tv: I like all movies except scary ones
associates.hobbies: travel, read, try new restaurants

associates.name: Krista Kobylianskii
associates.career: Assistant Teaching Professor in Chemistry
associates.bio: I've been teaching Chemistry at Rice since 2019 and I primarily teach the General Chemistry Laboratory course. I live just outside of Houston with my husband, son and cat. Before coming to Houston, I lived and researched in San Francisco, Zurich (Switzerland), Melbourne (Australia) and Victoria (Canada). So, if you need any travel tips, just ask!
associates.hobbies: Strategic board games and travelling
associates.fact: No one in my family has the same citizenship. I am Canadian, my husband is Russian and my son is American!

associates.name: Elizabeth Festa
associates.career: Proposal Development Specialist/Office of Research
associates.bio: I help faculty members in crafting proposals for federal funding for their research; my job affords me the  pleasure of engaging with research across all disciplines and schools at Rice.  I have worked at Rice in various capacities for 14 years (13 years as a faculty member) and am familiar with most offices/student services at Rice.  My hometown is Chantilly, Virginia (Wash. D.C. metropolitan area). I can advise students on research proposals (NSF, Fulbright etc. ) and graduate school/professional school applications.
associates.hobbies: museums, documentary films, reading, walking on Memorial Trails and going to the arboretum. I aspire to more hobbies on the long-term--I'd like to get back into English saddle horseback-riding at some point.
associates.fact: I have two very loud pets--a Siamese and a Min. Schnauzer

associates.name: Tawfik Jarjour
associates.career: Strategy Consultant
associates.bio: Tawfik is a Consultant at Accenture who focuses on helping High Tech and Software companies thrive in a post-covid, purpose filled, and value driven world by leveraging the best of Accenture. Tawfik serves his alma mater Rice University through his work on standing committees and the CCD Advisory Board. He is a fan of cooking, hiking, traveling, and meeting great people around the globe.
associates.hobbies: Cooking, Hiking, Soccer
associates.fact: I've worked in 11 different countries in a 12 month period
